description: Individual 2500-word essay with topic selection feedback (500-word outline worth 15%, final essay worth 35%). Requires understanding, discussion, and synthesis of ideas related to energy transition solutions.
Group research presentations on pre-assigned topics during weeks 3,4,5,7,9. Involves new research collaboration and communication to class.
Individual one-hour assessment in week 10 with multiple choice questions, short numerical responses, and short answers covering all course material including lectures and guest speaker content.
